metadata.title: CVE-2024-27297 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Nix is a package manager for Linux and other Unix systems. A fixed-outputderivations on Linux can send file descriptors to files in the Nix store toanother program running on the host (or another fixed-output derivation)via Unix domain sockets in the abstract namespace. This allows to modifythe output of the derivation, after Nix has registered the path as "valid"and immutable in the Nix database. In particular, this allows the output offixed-output derivations to be modified from their expected content. Thisissue has been addressed in versions 2.3.18 2.18.2 2.19.4 and 2.20.5. Usersare advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for thisvulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-27297` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

guix - 1.4.0-6
No subscription required
